skillTree.localised_description: Battle Wizards are rarely armoured for it interferes with their casting, yet a steed can and should be barded to add a level of protection.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

skillTree.localised_description: Imperial pegasi are found in Grey Mountains where Bretonnian and Empire hunters fight over capturing the foals.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: The relentless drive and fury of the Hammer, harnessed for the protection of this ward’s bearer.
This Lord belts out orders and can be heard even across a battlefield smothered in the grim noise of war.
A modicum of care is just common sense when getting it wrong can find you trapped in another, infinitely worse dimension…

target_if: Not on or below a platform
Not on or below a platform

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -10% for all spells

skillTree.localised_description: Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: After myriad hours of study, poring over arcane manuals and ancient, dusty tomes, mastery of spells now comes naturally.

effects.description: Cooldown: -10% to Lore of Life spells

skillTree.localised_description: Knowledge of ancient wisdoms often places Wizards into positions of great importance, enabling them to make connections across the Empire and foreign lands too.

effects.description: Boost Income action: Income is modified by an additional 5%

skillTree.localised_description: This Wizard has undoubtedly studied for many years to hone their craft, but there's always more to learn.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -10% for Lore of Life spells
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: Far from the frail and willowy image of decrepit old men secreted away in crumbling towers, Battle Wizards must be exemplars of well-honed athleticism and strength.
The Jade Order teaches of nature's power, and how to tap into its endless reserves of endurance.

related_attributes.bullet_text: Entities with this attribute ignore the effects of enemy contact effects such as  Poison

skillTree.localised_description: Trees live for thousands of years and have very long memories. When called to fight, centuries of pent-up wrath are unleashed.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Awakening of the Wood"

skillTree.localised_description: Even the simplest of spells can bring forth the full bloom of renewal, reinvigorating and healing the broken and bleeding.
The Wizard draws wholesome energies from the soil, imbuing companions with the natural resilience of the earth.

target_if: Hit point replenishment cap not reached
Hit point replenishment cap not reached

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Earth Blood"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Earth Blood Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Earth Blood Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: This spell temporarily transforms allies' mortal flesh into unbreakable rock, increasing tenfold their resistance to attack.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Flesh to Stone"
Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Flesh to Stone Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Flesh to Stone Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: Prickly gorse bursts from the ground around the caster's allies, protecting them from attack like a spiky, living shield.

ui_effects.localised_text: Reflects melee damage dealt to unit back at the attacker
Reflects melee damage dealt to unit back at the attacker

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Shield of Thorns"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Shield of Thorns Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Shield of Thorns Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: The Archmage crackles and flows with energies that would unmake any mortal practitioner.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +10

skillTree.localised_description: By speaking Druthandor's name the Wizard is able to heal allies' injuries much faster than by natural means.

target_if: Hit point replenishment cap not reached
Hit point replenishment cap not reached

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Regrowth Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: This spell causes gnarled, fibrous hands to emerge from beneath the ground, dragging the foe to a claustrophobic, suffocating end.

target_if: Not on or below a platform
Not on or below a platform

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Dwellers Below"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Dwellers Below Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Dwellers Below Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: “We march to war for our Emperor, and Sigmar, our saviour and lord.”

effects.description:
Melee defence: +4 for Spearmen, Swordsmen, Flagellants, Halberdiers, Stevedores and Sigmar Templars units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Spearmen, Swordsmen, Flagellants, Halberdiers, Stevedores and Sigmar Templars  units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +6 for Spearmen, Swordsmen, Flagellants, Halberdiers, Stevedores and Sigmar Templars units

skillTree.localised_description: These steeds are bred for speed and war, but foremost it is their gallop which marks them out.

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord expects his men to practice the disciplines of the Pistolkorps, and all be expert marksmen.

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Honest Empire-forged steel is all a state trooper could ask when confronting the myriad foes in battle.

skillTree.localised_description: Patrons of great forges and smiths expect, and are rewarded with, tougher and more enduring war machines.

skillTree.localised_description: Despite what the Dwarfs think, no other race can bring to bear such devastating artillery volleys.

Missile strength: +4% for Mortar, Great Cannon, Helblaster Volley Gun and Helstorm Rocket Battery units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The frontline will either make or break you. Those who survive become the backbone of any army.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +5 for Spearmen, Swordsmen, Halberdiers, Greatswords and Flagellants (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Armour: 10 for Spearmen, Swordsmen, Halberdiers, Greatswords and Flagellants (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 10% for Spearmen, Swordsmen, Halberdiers, Greatswords and Flagellants (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The veteran marksman knows the precise range required to land the killing shot.

effects.description:
Missile strength: +12% for Missile, Missile Cavalry and Missile Chariot units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +10% for Missile, Missile Cavalry and Missile Chariot units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Missile, Missile Cavalry and Missile Chariot units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Some men grow to relish war, dulled to the pain and living solely for the thrill of the kill.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 for Empire Knight and Demigryph units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +5 for Empire Knight and Demigryph units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Empire Knight and Demigryph units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those in command of ordnance can potentially decide a battle before the melee has even begun.

effects.description:
Ammunition: +20% for Mortar, Great Cannon, Helblaster Volley Gun, Helstorm Rocket Battery, War Wagon, Luminark of Hysh, Celestial Hurricanum and Steam Tank units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +10% for Mortar, Great Cannon, Helblaster Volley Gun, Helstorm Rocket Battery, War Wagon, Luminark of Hysh, Celestial Hurricanum and Steam Tank units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
Revered by the masses, such a celebrated leader will inspire many new recruits.
The presence of this Lord ensures a measure of calm, reducing panic and desertion amongst followers.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Through our acts, the gods will cleanse the lands.
It is said that Sigmar would bear a mortal wound and carry on fighting; this champion follows the hallowed Warrior-God.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his army fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.
Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +5%
Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: "Ever thought about joining the Elector's troops, chief? You'd make a good soldier alright."

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: This character has arcane conduit innately.
Trees live for thousands of years and have very long memories. When called to fight, centuries of pent-up wrath are unleashed.

target_if: Hit point replenishment cap not reached

backgroundSkills.localised_description: A regal air? Let's see how long that lasts.
"The smallfolk should be thankful - without us, who would they work for?"

effects.description:
Construction time: -25% for all buildings
	(local region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Franz has put his trust in this man; pray he does not let him down!
"If it's got a scent and footprints, I'll find it. Also, it helps if it's absolutely huge and can be spotted a league away."
The thrill of the chase, the tremor as the quarry is cornered, the ecstasy of the kill. These are the things that matter.
Being fleet of foot is useful in a fight… or when trying to get away afterwards!

related_attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description:
Ambush success chance: +10%
	(armies in local owned region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Having a modicum of resolve is useful in a world that continually tests it.

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.
Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.

effects.description: Magic item drop chance from battle: +15%

backgroundSkills.localised_description: If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
What this being doesn't know probably isn't worth knowing, so deep is their interest in the world and its ways.
Sharp minds make sharp blades sharper still.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +5% chance of wounding aggressors
